title: Carson Slater
text:
I am a third-year graduate student in the Department of Statistical Science at Baylor University. I moved to Waco after completing my undergraduate studies at Wheaton College, where I played baseball for the Thunder. I proudly hail from Phoenix and will spend every second I can visiting northern Arizona.
Generally speaking, you can find me at Grace Church Waco on a given Sunday morning, and I’m always trying to find a way to go back to the Czech Republic to work with Křesťanská Akademie Mladých again.
Currently, I am learning many new statistical methods that will enable me to build predictive models, understand stochastic phenomena, and discover associations in our world.

title: Carson Slater
text:
Education
Baylor University | Waco, TX M.S. in Statistics | 2023 - 2024 GPA: 3.83/4.00 Activities: Baylor Sports Analytics Club (President)
Wheaton College (IL) | Wheaton, IL B.S. Applied Mathematics, B.A. Economics | 2019 - 2023 GPA: 3.46/4.00 Activities: Varsity Baseball, Sophomore Class Council

title: Carson Slater
text:
Experience
Graduate Assistant | Baylor University Aug 2023 - Present

Currently, I am a research assistant with Dr. Mandy Hering where we collaborate with a utility for a Major US city.
I consulted at Baylor University in the Statistical Consulting Center, and am a teaching assistant for both the undergraduate and graduate offerings of Computational Statistics (STA 4373/5373/6375) with Dr. David Kahle.
I have worked with Dr. Mandy Hering also with her on her contributions to the National Science Foundation Harnessing the Data Revolution: Data Science Corps project (Grant no. #1924146).
I have also worked as a graduate supplemental instructor for the Introduction to Statistical Methods course (STA 2381).

Intern | KAM (Křesťanská Akademie Mladých) June 2023 - Aug 2023
After support raising for four months, I spent two and a half months working for a youth missions organization in Central and Eastern Europe, called KAM. For this work I lived in Ostrava, CZ where I assisted local CB churches with youth outreach through camps where I taught English and sports. I also helped onboard short-term mission teams who joined us for camps.
Academic Coach | Wheaton Academy Jan 2023 - May 2023
In this role I met with students 1-on-1 per their request to teach, review, and sharpen their math skills. I met with students ranging in courses from Algebra I to AP Statistics to help them prepare for their exams, whether it’s ones for courses or AP exams.
Teaching Assistant | Wheaton College Aug 2022 - May 2023
I was the teaching assistant for Dr. Peter Jantsch in the fall of 2022 and spring of 2023. I hosted weekly help sessions for students to come in for extra help, and graded course homework. The courses I helped with were: - MATH 465: Applied Machine Learning - MATH 363: Probability Theory
